titleStmt.title: The lady of pleasure, or, The London misses frolick, whereby she got money by her subtile devices and witty intreagues, as she led in the loose course of her life, which you'l find by the subsequent matter To a pleasant new play-house tune. This may be printed, R.L.S.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J[ohn]. Back, at the Black-Boy on London-Bridge.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "There was a lass in London town ..."
Place, date of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
